concise_definition: aux. 不会, 不愿意, 不曾 (will not 的缩写形式)

definitions.explanation_en: The contracted form of 'would not', used to express refusal, unwillingness, or the negative form of a conditional or hypothetical situation in the past or future.
definitions.explanation_cn: 是 'would not' 的缩写形式，用于表达拒绝、不愿意，或在过去或将来情境中的否定性假设、条件句。
definitions.example_en: She wouldn't listen to my advice, no matter how hard I tried.
definitions.example_cn: 无论我怎么努力，她都不肯听我的建议。

definitions.explanation_en: Used in polite requests or hypothetical scenarios to indicate a negative outcome that did not or will not occur.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于礼貌请求或假设情境中，表示某种结果未曾发生或将不会发生。
definitions.example_en: I wouldn't go there if I were you.
definitions.example_cn: 如果我是你，我就不会去那里。

definitions.explanation_en: Expresses a past habitual negative action or refusal, often implying stubbornness or resistance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 表示过去反复发生的否定性行为或拒绝，常暗示固执或抗拒。
definitions.example_en: He wouldn't clean his room, even when his parents asked him every day.
definitions.example_cn: 即使父母每天要求他，他也不肯打扫房间。

comparison.analysis: “Won't” 是 “will not” 的缩写，用于表达现在或未来的拒绝或不愿意，具有更强的现实性和即时性。而 “wouldn't” 更常用于过去时态或虚拟语气，表达假设、礼貌或非现实情境中的否定。例如：He won't come today（他今天不会来） vs. He wouldn't come even if I begged him（即使我求他，他也不会来）。
“Couldn't” 是 “could not” 的缩写，强调能力或可能性的缺失（“不能”），而 “wouldn't” 强调意愿或选择上的拒绝（“不愿”）。例如：I couldn't lift the box（我搬不动这个箱子）vs. I wouldn't lift the box（我懒得搬这个箱子）。
“Shouldn't” 是 “should not” 的缩写，用于表达建议、义务或道德上的不应该，带有规范性判断。而 “wouldn't” 更侧重于行为倾向或事实性拒绝，不包含道德评价。例如：You shouldn't smoke（你不该抽烟）vs. He wouldn't smoke even if you offered him money（即使你给他钱，他也不抽烟）。
